io.discloader.discloader.entity.guild

Class Guild

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.discloader.discloader.entity.guild.Guild

  • public class Guild
extends java.lang.Object
    This represents a Guild in Discord's API
    Since:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Perry Berman

      • beginPrune

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Integer> beginPrune()
        Begin a prune operation. Requires the 'KICK_MEMBERS' permission.
        Returns:
        A Future that completes with the number of member kicked during the prune operation if successful.

      • beginPrune

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Integer> beginPrune(int days)
        Begin a prune operation. Requires the 'KICK_MEMBERS' permission.
        Parameters:
        days - The number of days to prune (1 or more)
        Returns:
        A Future that completes with the number of member kicked during the prune operation if successful.

      • createRole

                                                               int permissions,
                                                               int color)
        Creates a new Role.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the role
        permissions - The 53bit Permissions integer to assign to the role
        color - The color of the role
        Returns:
        A future that completes with a new Role Object if successful.
        Since:
        0.0.3

      • createRole

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<Role> createRole(java.lang.String name,
                                                               int permissions,
                                                               int color,
                                                               boolean hoist,
                                                               boolean mentionable)
        Creates a new Role.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the role
        permissions - The 53bit Permissions integer to assign to the role
        color - The color of the role
        hoist - Display role members separately from online members
        mentionable - Allow anyone to @mention this role
        Returns:
        A future that completes with a new Role Object if successful.
        Since:
        0.0.3

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<Guild> delete()

        Returns:
        A Future that completes with this if successful, and fails with a UnauthorizedException

        Returns:

      • fetchMembers

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,GuildMember>> fetchMembers(int limit,
                                                                                                            java.lang.String after)
        Gets a HashMap of GuildMembers that are in the guild.
        Parameters:
        limit - max number of members to return (1-1000) default 50
        after - The highest user id in the previous page
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that completes with a HashMap of GuildMembers if successful, null otherwise.

      • fetchMembers

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,GuildMember>> fetchMembers(java.lang.String after)
        Gets a HashMap of GuildMembers that are in the guild. Only retrieves 50 members
        Parameters:
        after - The highest user id in the previous page
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture that completes with a HashMap of GuildMembers if successful, null otherwise.

      • getDefaultChannel

        public TextChannel getDefaultChannel()
        Gets the guild's default text channel. the id of the channel should be the same as the guild's id
        Returns:
        the default TextChannel

      • getInvites

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Invite>> getInvites()
        Retrieves the guild's invites from Discord's API
        Returns:
        A Future that completes with a HashMap of Invite objects, indexed by Invite.code, if successful.

      • getPruneCount

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Integer> getPruneCount()
        same as getPruneCount(int days) but only grabs one days worth
        Returns:
        A Future that completes with the number of member that would be kicked in a prune operation

      • getPruneCount

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Integer> getPruneCount(int days)
        Returns the number of members that would be removed in a prune operation. Requires the Kick Members permission.
        Parameters:
        days - The number of days to count prune for (1 or more)
        Returns:
        A Future that completes with the number of member that would be kicked in a prune operation
